fields.summary: BlackBerry: KitchenSink  app crashes on launch error enabling Appcelerator services during app creation

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5. To reproduce
1. Import Kitchen Sink from Samples> Appcelerator Classic
2. Enable BB platform in tiapp.xml overview
3. Run on BB device

h5. Actual result
crash
fields.summary: BlackBerry: Kitchen Sink, imported from Studio Samples crashes on launch
fields.environment:
Mac osx 10.9.3 Mavericks
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201406061445
Titanium SDK, build: 3.3.0.v20140609184912 
Node.JS Version: v0.10.13 
NPM Version: 1.3.2 
acs@1.0.14 
alloy@1.4.0-beta 
npm@1.3.2 
titanium@3.3.0-beta2 
titanium-code-processor@1.1.1
Device: BB Z10 (10.2.1)

comments.body:
The fixed was merged into master, once master is merged into stable, Kitchen Sink will not crash.
PR: https://github.com/appcelerator/KitchenSink/pull/15
Marking this as fixed. Please import sample from the suggested branch

KS master, imported from  https://github.com/appcelerator/KitchenSink works.
I will wait for the merge before closing this ticket.

Imported KS from Studio Samples does not crash.
Tested with:
Mac osx 10.9.3 Mavericks
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201406111952
Titanium SDK, build: 3.3.0.v20140612101712
Node.JS Version: v0.10.13 
NPM Version: 1.3.2 
acs@1.0.14 
alloy@1.4.0-rc 
npm@1.3.2 
titanium@3.3.0-rc 
titanium-code-processor@1.1.1
Device: BB Z10 (10.2.1)
